seg-source.mrk: shutdown=true attribute

target.mrk: shutdown=true attribute

seg-source.mrk: shutdown=true database connection URL attribute

target.mrk: shutdown=true database connection URL attribute

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Shuts down the specified database if you specify a databaseName. (Reconnecting to the database reboots the database.) For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the database owner can perform shutdown of that database. Please see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Shuts down the specified database if you specify a databaseName.

(Reconnecting to the database reboots the database.) For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform shutdown of that database.
Please see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

target.mrk: Shuts down the specified database if you specify a databaseName.

(Reconnecting to the database reboots the database.) For a database for which authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the <xref href="rrefattrib26867.dita#rrefattrib26867">database owner</xref> can perform shutdown of that database.
Please see "Enabling user authentication" and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Shuts down the entire system if and only if you do not specify a databaseName.

seg-source.mrk: Shuts down the entire system if and only if you do not specify a databaseName.

target.mrk: Shuts down the entire system if and only if you do not specify a databaseName.

trans-unit.source: When you are shutting down a single database, it lets <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> perform a final checkpoint on the database.

seg-source.mrk: When you are shutting down a single database, it lets <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> perform a final checkpoint on the database.

target.mrk: When you are shutting down a single database, it lets <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> perform a final checkpoint on the database.

trans-unit.source: When you are shutting down a system, it lets perform a final checkpoint on all system databases, deregister the JDBC driver (if permitted; see deregister=false), and shut down within the JVM before the JVM exits. A successful shutdown always results in an SQLException indicating that has shut down and that there is no connection. Once is shut down, you can restart it by reloading the driver. For details on restarting , see "Shutting down the system" in the .

seg-source.mrk: When you are shutting down a system, it lets perform a final checkpoint on all system databases, deregister the JDBC driver (if permitted; see deregister=false), and shut down within the JVM before the JVM exits.
A successful shutdown always results in an SQLException indicating that has shut down and that there is no connection.
Once <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is shut down, you can restart it by reloading the driver.
For details on restarting <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, see "Shutting down the system" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: When you are shutting down a system, it lets perform a final checkpoint on all system databases, deregister the JDBC driver (if permitted; see deregister=false), and shut down within the JVM before the JVM exits.
A successful shutdown always results in an SQLException indicating that has shut down and that there is no connection.
Once <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is shut down, you can restart it by reloading the driver.
For details on restarting <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph>, see "Shutting down the system" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

trans-unit.source: Checkpointing means writing all data and transaction information to disk so that no recovery needs to be performed at the next connection.

seg-source.mrk: Checkpointing means writing all data and transaction information to disk so that no recovery needs to be performed at the next connection.

target.mrk: Checkpointing means writing all data and transaction information to disk so that no recovery needs to be performed at the next connection.

trans-unit.source: Used to shut down the entire system only when it is embedded in an application.

seg-source.mrk: Used to shut down the entire system only when it is embedded in an application.

target.mrk: Used to shut down the entire system only when it is embedded in an application.

trans-unit.source: Any request to the DriverManager with a shutdown=true attribute raises an exception.

seg-source.mrk: Any request to the DriverManager with a shutdown=true attribute raises an exception.

target.mrk: Any request to the DriverManager with a shutdown=true attribute raises an exception.

seg-source.mrk: Combining with other attributes

target.mrk: Combining with other attributes

trans-unit.source: This attribute may be combined with the deregister=false attribute.

seg-source.mrk: This attribute may be combined with the deregister=false attribute.

target.mrk: This attribute may be combined with the deregister=false attribute.

trans-unit.source: When you shut down a database, if authentication is turned on, you must specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes. If both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, the user must be the database owner.

seg-source.mrk: When you shut down a database, if authentication is turned on, you must specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.
If both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, the user must be the database owner.

target.mrk: When you shut down a database, if authentication is turned on, you must specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.
If both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, the user must be the database owner.

trans-unit.source: When you shut down the system, if both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, you must specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.

seg-source.mrk: When you shut down the system, if both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, you must specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.

target.mrk: When you shut down the system, if both authentication and SQL authorization are turned on, you must specify this attribute in conjunction with the user=userName and password=userPassword attributes.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

trans-unit.source: -- shut down entire system jdbc:derby:;shutdown=true -- shut down salesDB (authentication not enabled) jdbc:derby:salesDB;shutdown=true -- shut down an in-memory database using the embedded driver jdbc:derby:memory:myInMemDB;shutdown=true -- shut down an in-memory database using the Network Server jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/memory:myInMemDB;shutdown=true

seg-source.mrk: -- shut down entire system jdbc:derby:;shutdown=true -- shut down salesDB (authentication not enabled) jdbc:derby:salesDB;shutdown=true -- shut down an in-memory database using the embedded driver jdbc:derby:memory:myInMemDB;shutdown=true -- shut down an in-memory database using the Network Server jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/memory:myInMemDB;shutdown=true

target.mrk: -- shut down entire system jdbc:derby:;shutdown=true -- shut down salesDB (authentication not enabled) jdbc:derby:salesDB;shutdown=true -- shut down an in-memory database using the embedded driver jdbc:derby:memory:myInMemDB;shutdown=true -- shut down an in-memory database using the Network Server jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/memory:myInMemDB;shutdown=true
